treatment.reference: Methanobacterium congolense sp. nov., from a methanogenic fermentation of cassava peel IJSEM 51:489-493.
treatment.description: Colonies are circular, white, opaque, raised at the centres, have rough surfaces and entire margins and are up to 1 mm in diameter. The cells are rods, 0.4-0.5 µm wide by 2-10 µm long, occurring individually or in pairs, rarely in chains and small aggregates. Gram-positive. Non-motile. Methanogenic. Obligatory member of the Euryarchaeota of the domain Archaea. H2/CO2 is the only substrate that supports growth. Methane is produced from 2-propanol/CO2, 2-butanol/CO2, and cyclopentanol/CO2 without growth. Formate, acetate, methanol, ethanol, 1-propanol, isobutanol, 1-butanol, pentanol, methylamine and trimethylamine are not used. Growth factors such as yeast extract, bio-Trypcase and vitamins are not required. The optimum growth temperature is between 37 and 42 °C. No growth occurs at 25 or 50 °C. The optimum pH is 7.2; no growth occurs at pH 5.9 or 8.2. The doubling time under optimal growth conditions is 7.5 h. The DNA base composition is 39.5±0.3 mol% G+C (as determined by HPLC). Isolated from an anaerobic digester used for the treatment of cassava peel in the Congo (Central Africa). The type strain is strain CT (=DSM 7095T=OCM 779T).
